title: 116 arrested in U.K. as violent far-right protests erupt over deadly stabbing
content: Demonstrations in cities like Liverpool, Hull and Bristol turned violent, prompting arrests. Misinformation about a knife attack in Southport, England, spurred far-right protests.
summary: Demonstrations in cities like Liverpool, Hull and Bristol turned violent, prompting arrests. Misinformation about a knife attack in Southport, England, spurred far-right protests.

title: Israeli raids in West Bank cities help fuel militant violence
content: In the city of Jenin, the impact of the raids — and their role in fueling Palestinian militancy — is especially stark.
summary: In the city of Jenin, the impact of the raids — and their role in fueling Palestinian militancy — is especially stark.

title: Death of Hamas chief draws mixed reactions in war-battered Gaza
content: By the time Ismail Haniyeh was killed early Wednesday in Tehran, he had traded his humble life in Gaza for a more comfortable perch abroad.
summary: By the time Ismail Haniyeh was killed early Wednesday in Tehran, he had traded his humble life in Gaza for a more comfortable perch abroad.

title: Iran gives first detailed statement on Hamas leader’s killing
content: Ismail Haniyeh was killed by a short-range projectile, Iran’s Revolutionary Guards said in Tehran’s first detailed statement on the assassination.
summary: Ismail Haniyeh was killed by a short-range projectile, Iran’s Revolutionary Guards said in Tehran’s first detailed statement on the assassination.

title: Taiwan is readying citizens for a Chinese invasion. It’s not going well.
content: The government extended mandatory military service and revamped reservist training in an effort to make Beijing think twice. But it’s already falling short.
summary: The government extended mandatory military service and revamped reservist training in an effort to make Beijing think twice. But it’s already falling short.

title: They were in prison in the West. Now they’re celebrities in Russia.
content: For Russians returning home in a prisoner swap, time spent in an American prison can be a great career move.
summary: For Russians returning home in a prisoner swap, time spent in an American prison can be a great career move.

title: How many hostages are still in Gaza since Hamas attack on Israel? What to know.
content: Israel estimates some 116 hostages held by Hamas have been released or freed; 72 are believed still to be alive in Gaza. Here’s what we know.
summary: Israel estimates some 116 hostages held by Hamas have been released or freed; 72 are believed still to be alive in Gaza. Here’s what we know.

title: Left and right have denounced Venezuela’s Maduro. Not the authoritarians.
content: After the strongman claimed reelection Sunday, even leftist allies distanced themselves. Russia, China, Iran and Cuba continue to stand by their man.
summary: After the strongman claimed reelection Sunday, even leftist allies distanced themselves. Russia, China, Iran and Cuba continue to stand by their man.

title: Al Jazeera rejects Israeli allegation that slain journalist was Hamas fighter
content: Ismail al-Ghoul, the channel’s Gaza correspondent, was killed in an Israeli airstrike this week. Al Jazeera said allegations that he was a member of Hamas’s military wing are “baseless.”
summary: Ismail al-Ghoul, the channel’s Gaza correspondent, was killed in an Israeli airstrike this week. Al Jazeera said allegations that he was a member of Hamas’s military wing are “baseless.”

title: U.S. forces move toward Israel as Iran threatens to attack
content: The Pentagon has relocated several warships in recent days as Iran threatens to attack Israel and avenge the killing of key leaders of Hamas and Hezbollah.
summary: The Pentagon has relocated several warships in recent days as Iran threatens to attack Israel and avenge the killing of key leaders of Hamas and Hezbollah.

title: After assassinations, Israel braces for retaliation, wider conflict
content: In the space of 24 hours this week, each of Israel’s chief adversaries vowed to deal the Jewish state a searing, potentially unprecedented blow.
summary: In the space of 24 hours this week, each of Israel’s chief adversaries vowed to deal the Jewish state a searing, potentially unprecedented blow.

title: Homeland Security Dept. pauses Biden parole program for four countries
content: The Biden administration said it paused a program that admits up to 360,000 people a year from four countries into the United States to work or seek asylum.
summary: The Biden administration said it paused a program that admits up to 360,000 people a year from four countries into the United States to work or seek asylum.

title: Children returned to Russia had no idea parents were spies, Kremlin says
content: Anna and Artem Dultsev, spies posing as Argentine expats living in Slovenia, were returned to Russia with their children, ages 8 and 11, who do not speak Russian.
summary: Anna and Artem Dultsev, spies posing as Argentine expats living in Slovenia, were returned to Russia with their children, ages 8 and 11, who do not speak Russian.

title: Russian opposition figure Ilya Yashin says he demanded not to be freed
content: Ilya Yashin, a longtime ally of the late opposition leader Alexei Navalny, says he demanded not to be part of a prisoner exchange and was made to leave Russia against his will.
summary: Ilya Yashin, a longtime ally of the late opposition leader Alexei Navalny, says he demanded not to be part of a prisoner exchange and was made to leave Russia against his will.

title: Ukraine watches warily as prisoner swap shows Moscow and West can negotiate
content: After a landmark prisoner deal showed Moscow and Washington can still do business, Kyiv said it would hold President Biden to his promise: ‘Nothing about Ukraine without Ukraine.’
summary: After a landmark prisoner deal showed Moscow and Washington can still do business, Kyiv said it would hold President Biden to his promise: ‘Nothing about Ukraine without Ukraine.’

title: Kremlin hails return of spies but says swap won’t end fight over Ukraine
content: The welcoming of freed prisoners in Moscow, Washington and Cologne, Germany showcased the wide gulf between Russia and the West amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.
summary: The welcoming of freed prisoners in Moscow, Washington and Cologne, Germany showcased the wide gulf between Russia and the West amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

title: ‘I love my black job’: Simone Biles joins those throwing shade at Trump
content: The former president has prompted criticism for asserting without evidence that immigrants coming into the United States illegally are “taking Black jobs.”
summary: The former president has prompted criticism for asserting without evidence that immigrants coming into the United States illegally are “taking Black jobs.”

title: 3 Americans freed in major prisoner swap with Russia are welcomed home
content: Evan Gershkovich, Alsu Kurmasheva and Paul Whelan were greeted by President Biden and Vice President Harris as they arrived at Joint Base Andrews in Maryland.
summary: Evan Gershkovich, Alsu Kurmasheva and Paul Whelan were greeted by President Biden and Vice President Harris as they arrived at Joint Base Andrews in Maryland.

title: For Parisians, Olympic summer brings frustrations but also joy
content: The 2024 Olympic Games have elevated security concerns and upended tourism but also infused Paris with new energy.
summary: The 2024 Olympic Games have elevated security concerns and upended tourism but also infused Paris with new energy.
